title: Bound Print, View of the Stable Front, 1808
medium: Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper
markings: Line at lower center of overlay
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower left: H. Repton Esq. del; lower center: London: Pub. May 1, 1808 by J C Stadler no. 15 Villiers Street Strand; lower right: J.C. Stadler sculpt
dimensions:
H x W: 20.5 x 26.6 cm (8 1/16 x 10 1/2 in.)
Other (Overlay): 15.3 x 26.8 cm (6 x 10 9/16 in.)
Platemark: 22.8 x 29 cm (9 in. x 11 7/16 in.)
description:
Image: In foreground a square pool reflecting the stable front structure. A two-storied building with windows in gothic style, a multi-paned dome, and a pagoda-like ornament at top. An allée of trees at left, rose bushes and shrubbery surround pool. A woman with a parasol, a man and a small boy are reflected in the pool as are two male figures at right.
Overlay: At right allées of trees, three young boys, possibly gardeners, and  a gentlewoman in a red coat standing on grass in front of stable

tombstone.epitaph:
Bound Print, View of the Stable Front, 1808. Aquatint, brush and watercolor on cream wove paper. 
1956-156-1-d
